  • Description: During sort operations at the MEMH location an overpack shipment was dropped while being moved by a forklift. The plastic jerrycan received a puncture on the side releasing the contents. The plastic jerrycan was placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report X-2024090649
item.description:
Report X-2024090649

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-13T09:14:00+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-04
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A fiberboard box with signs of a release was discovered during sort operations at the MEMH location. The fiberboard box contained four metal cans with positive closure rings and fiberboard dividers. One of the cans was damaged on the bottom chime causing the release. All the contents were placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report X-2024090650
item.description:
Report X-2024090650

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-13T09:14:00+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-04
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During sort operations at the MEMH location a fiberboard box fell off the conveyer belt damaging the outer packaging and contents. The fiberboard box contained two one gallon cans packaged in plastic bags, separate with a divider and bubble wrap for dunnage. One the cans was damaged on the bottom chime causing the release. The contents were placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report X-2024090484
item.description:
Report X-2024090484

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-13T09:14:00+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-29
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During sort operation at the MEMH location a fiberboard box was found with signs of a release. The fiberboard box contained two metal cans in plastic bags, positive closure tabs and packing paper for dunnage. Both cans were dented on the top chime causing the lids to open and spill the contents. The shipment was placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report E-2024090126
item.description:
Report E-2024090126

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-12T09:14:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-08
  • City: GOODLETTSVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 2-liters of pear and grease instant power drain opener released from a plastic bottle due to a forklift accident. The release impacted the concrete dock. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and they determined that terminal personnel were capable of cleaning the release with the PPE available on site.
